title: Extending Independence and Quality of Life for People With Alzheimer's Disease or Dementia Through Telehealth Program Delivery
description_brief: To determine whether Moving Together improves quality of life in people with memory loss (PWML) and caregivers (CG) by performing a randomized, controlled trial (RCT) with a waitlist control group in 224 dyads.
description_detailed:
The investigators will perform an RCT with a 12-week delayed start control group in 224 dyads of PWMLs and CGs. The primary outcome in PWML will be self-rated quality of life (Quality of Life in Alzheimer's Disease, QOL-AD). Secondary outcomes will include: a) self-reported emotional well-being; b) self-reported social isolation; c) self-reported mobility; and d) directly assess cognitive performance. In CGs, the primary outcome will be self-rated quality of life (SF-12). Secondary outcomes in CGs will include: a) healthy days; b) self-efficacy; c) burden; d) social isolation; e) ability to self-regulate; f) positive affect; and g) sleep quality. In addition, the investigators will ask CGs to report sleep quality, mobility, and cognitive function for PWML. Additional exploratory outcomes will include health services utilization (hospitalizations, emergency department visits) and falls.

In addition to the RCT, the investigators propose to compare health utilization outcomes in study participants to a matched 'no contact' comparison sample of patients with dementia diagnoses who receive care in the University of California San Francisco (UCSF) Health system.

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Study participants are enrolled as dyads of persons living with dementia (PLWD) and care partners (CPs).

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks for PLWD.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by optional continuation of classes for 12 weeks for PLWD.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes for 12 weeks (1 hour, 2 days/week) for CPs.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by optional continuation of classes for 12 weeks for CPs.

measures.title: Quick Dementia Rating System (QDRS)
measures.description: 10-item validated questionnaire. Scores range from 0 to 30 with higher scores indicating greater cognitive impairment. Enrollment restricted to participants with scores of 2.5 to 12.5 (mild severity).

outcomeMeasures.title: Quality of Life - Change (Quality of Life in Alzheimer's Disease Scale, QOL-AD)
outcomeMeasures.description: The QOL-AD is a standard quality of life measure that has been validated for people with cognitive impairment. Scores may range from 0-52, with higher scores reflecting better quality of life.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only measured in PLWD. Baseline data missing for 1 participant in the Moving Together group.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

analyses.estimateComment: The mean difference estimate of 2.2 was confirmed. It is slightly different than the difference of the raw change values \[+.7 - (-1.7) = 2.4\] because it comes from the mixed effects model.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Physical Health - Change (Short Form Health Survey [SF-12] Physical Composite Score [PCS])
outcomeMeasures.description: The Short Form Health Survey (SF-12) is a 12-item questionnaire that was developed as a shorter alternative to the SF-36 Health Survey (SF-36). It consists of a subset of 12 items from the SF-36 covering the same eight domains of health outcomes and generates two summary scores: the Physical and Mental Health Composite Scores (PCS, MCS). Scores may range from 0-100, with higher scores reflecting better levels of health.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Mental Health - Change (Short Form - 12 [SF-12] Mental Composite Score [MCS])
outcomeMeasures.description: The Short Form Health Survey (SF-12) is a 12-item questionnaire that was developed as a shorter alternative to the SF-36 Health Survey (SF-36). It consists of a subset of 12 items from the SF-36 covering the same eight domains of health outcomes and generates two summary scores: the Physical and Mental Health Composite Scores (PCS, MCS). Scores may range from 0-100, with higher scores reflecting better levels of health.

groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Well-being - Change (Neuro-QOL v1.0 Positive Affect and Well-Being Short Form)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Neuro-QOL v1.0 Positive Affect and Well-Being Short Form includes 9 items (e.g. sense of well-being, feeling hopeful, life was satisfying, etc.) with 5-point responses from never (1) to always (5). Scores range from 0-40 with higher scores indicating increased mobility.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only measured in PLWD. Data missing for 1 participant.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Social Isolation - Change (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System v2.0 Social Isolation Scale)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System v2.0 social isolation scale consists of 4 items (feeling left out, people barely know me, feeling isolated, people are around but not with me) that are rated as 1 (never), 2 (rarely), 3 (sometimes), 4 (usually), or 5 (always). Scores range from 0-20 with higher scores indicating less perceived social isolation.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Measured in PLWD. Data missing for 1 participant.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mobility - Change (Neuro-QOL Short Form V1.0 - Lower Extremity Function - Mobility)
outcomeMeasures.description: The (Neuro-QOL Short Form v1.0 -- Lower Extremity Function -- Mobility), which includes 8 items for functional mobility (getting on and off the toilet, getting in and out of a car, getting out of bed into a chair). Responses are rated on a 5-point Likert scale: 1( Without any difficult), 2 (With a little difficulty), 3 (With some difficulty), 4 (With much difficulty), 5 (Unable to do). Scores may range from 0-40 with higher scores indicating increased mobility.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Measure applies to PLWD. Data missing for 1 Moving Together participant.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cognitive Function - Change (Telephone Montreal Cognitive Assessment, t-MoCA)
outcomeMeasures.description: The t-MoCA is extracted from the original face-to-face MoCA and uses items not requiring the use of a pencil and paper or visual stimulus. Scores may range from 0-22 with higher scores indicating higher cognitive function.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Measured only in PLWD. Data missing for 1 Moving Together participant.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Healthy Days - Change (Healthy Days Core Module)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Healthy Days Core Modules includes 3 questions about the number of days during the past 30 days that physical or mental health was not good or poor physical or mental health kept from doing usual activities. Scores range from 0-18 with lower scores indicating higher physical or mental health.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Self-efficacy - Change (Gain in Alzheimer Care INstrument (GAIN))
outcomeMeasures.description: The GAIN consists of 10-items (e.g., increased my self-awareness, increased my knowledge and skills in dementia care) using a Likert scale from 0 (disagree a lot) to 4 (agree a lot). Scores range from 0 to 40 with higher scores indicating increased positive feelings about caregiving

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Burden - Change (Zarit Burden Interview, 6-item Version)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Zarit Burden Interview is one of the most widely used assessments for caregiver burden covering areas including caregiver's health, psychological well-being, finances, social life, and the relationship between the caregiver and the person with dementia. Scores range from 0-24 with higher scores indicating positive caregiver experience.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Social Isolation - Change (PROMIS v2.0 Social Isolation Scale)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System v2.0 social isolation scale consists of 4 items (feeling left out, people barely know me, feeling isolated, people are around but not with me) that are rated as 1 (never), 2 (rarely), 3 (sometimes), 4 (usually), or 5 (always). Scores range from 0-20 with higher scores indicating less perceived social isolation.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Self-regulation - Change (Abbreviated Multidimensional Assessment of Interoceptive Awareness-2 (MAIA) Self-regulation Subscale)
outcomeMeasures.description: The MAIA-2 - Self-regulation subscale is designed to assess ability to regulate distress by attention to body sensations (e.g., when I feel overwhelmed, I can find a calm place inside). Scores range from 0-20 with higher scores indicating increased self-regulation.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Positive Affect (Positive States of Mind)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Positive States of Mind scale is designed to assess types of positive mood (e.g., focused attention, productivity, responsible caregiving, etc.). This scale consists of 6-items using a 4-point Likert scale from 0 (Unable to have it) to 3 (Have it Easily). Scores range from 0-18 with higher scores indicating positive mood.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Sleep - Change (Symptom Checklist, 3 Items)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Symptom Checklist-90-Revised is a 90-item self-report questionnaire often used to assess global psychological distress and the investigators will be using 3 items assessing: trouble falling asleep, awakening in the early morning, and sleep that is restless or disturbed. Scores range from 0-12 with lower scores indicating less sleep difficulties.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - CP
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - CP
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: People With Memory Loss (PWML) Sleep - Change (Symptom Checklist, 3 Items)
outcomeMeasures.description: Caregivers also will be asked about sleep for the PWML using the 3 sleep items from the Symptom Checklist-90-Revised (trouble falling asleep, awakening in the early morning, and sleep that is restless or disturbed). Scores range from 0-12 with lower scores indicating less sleep difficulties.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Measure only asked of CPs regarding PLWD.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: People With Memory Loss (PWML) Mobility - Change (Neuro-QOL Short Form V1.0 - Lower Extremity Function - Mobility)
outcomeMeasures.description: As described above, the Neuro-QOL Short Form v1.0 - Lower Extremity Function - Mobility includes 8 items for functional mobility (e.g. getting on and off the toilet, getting in and out of a car, getting out of bed into a chair, etc.). CGs will be asked about the mobility of the PWML. Scores range from 0-35 with higher scores indicating less physical difficulty with daily activities.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Measure asked of CPs regarding PLWD.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: People With Memory Loss (PWML) Cognitive Function - Change (Cognitive Function Instrument - Modified)
outcomeMeasures.description: The original Cognitive Function Instrument included 14 items that asked about decline in cognitive function (e.g., memory, tendency to repeat questions, misplacing things, etc.) compared to 1 year ago with responses of yes (1), no (0) or maybe (0.5). The investigators will be using a modified 11-item version that excludes items on driving, managing money, work; asking about change in the past 3 months (to match the duration of our study); and using a 5-point Likert scale from 1 (a lot worse) to 5 (a lot better). Scores range from 0-55 with higher scores indicating improved cognitive function.

groups.title: Waitlist Control - PLWD
groups.description: Usual activities for 12 weeks followed by Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks.

groups.title: Moving Together - PLWD
groups.description: Synchronous, online, mind-body group movement classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks followed by return to usual activities for 12 weeks.

adverseEventsModule.description: Care partners are sent a month survey that asks about hospitalizations, emergency department visits, falls, and other unexpected major medical events or changes to health in the past month for themselves and PLWD. We did not group events by organ system; therefore, they are reported as general events.

eventGroups.title: Immediate Start - Care Partners (CPs)
eventGroups.description: The Immediate Start group will participate in Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks and will then return to usual activities for 12 weeks. Adverse events are reported separately for care partners (CPs) and participants living with dementia (PLWD).

eventGroups.title: Immediate Start - Participants Living With Dementia (PLWD)
eventGroups.description: The Immediate Start group will participate in Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks and will then return to usual activities for 12 weeks. Adverse events are reported separately for care partners (CPs) and participants living with dementia (PLWD).

eventGroups.title: Delayed Start - Care Partners (CPs)
eventGroups.description: The Delayed Start group will engage in usual activities for 12 weeks and will then participate in Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks. Adverse events are reported separately for care partners (CPs) and participants living with dementia (PLWD).

eventGroups.title: Delayed Start - Participants Living With Dementia (PLWD)
eventGroups.description: The Delayed Start group will engage in usual activities for 12 weeks and will then participate in Moving Together classes (1 hour, 2 days/week) for 12 weeks. Adverse events are reported separately for care partners (CPs) and participants living with dementia (PLWD).

limitationsAndCaveats.description: Dyads were enrolled in cohorts with a goal of 16 dyads per cohort. Our original target sample size of 224 dyads (112/group) was reduced to 112 dyads (56/group) following a futility analysis requested by our Safety Officer (SO). We did not penalize the alpha for this unplanned interim analysis. Due to time and funding constraints, the 7th (final) cohort only included 10 dyads, all of whom were assigned to the Immediate Start (Moving Together) group.

explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is "Moving Together," an online, live‑streamed, mind‑body group movement program (gentle movement + mindful body awareness + social interaction) delivered to dyads of people with memory loss and their caregivers. The trial is a randomized, waitlist‑controlled RCT assessing quality of life as the primary outcome — this is a non‑pharmacologic/behavioral telehealth program, not a drug or biologic. citeturn0search3turn0search6

Act: Key trial details extracted from published and registry sources — randomized, waitlist control design (ClinicalTrials.gov NCT04621448), Moving Together is 1 hour, 2 days/week for 12 weeks, and outcomes focus on self‑reported quality of life, mobility, falls, caregiver stress, etc. No drug, biologic, or placebo is used or mentioned. citeturn0search0turn0search6

Reflect: Classification check — this intervention is behavioral/rehabilitative (telehealth movement program) intended to improve quality of life and caregiver stress. It does not meet the definitions for (1) disease‑targeted biologic, (2) disease‑targeted small molecule, (3) cognitive enhancer (pharmacologic), or (4) neuropsychiatric symptom–specific pharmacologic treatment. Therefore the correct category is 'N/A'. Sources used: published trial full text and abstract, trial registry, and program/company pages. citeturn0search3turn0search0turn0search6turn0search7
